a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2023
a-size-base 3: Ferrets can be somewhat picky in their taste for treats. We have two (2) ferrets and only one (1) liked these Bacon flavored treats.  We have purchased both the Chicken and Bacon flavored treats in the past. One thing to note. It seems that the company recently changed their Chicken flavored treat product. However, reading the ingredients for the older version and the new version, they are identical but the treats themselves are NOT the same. The Chicken flavored product used to be a brown color and both our ferrets loved those treats. We recently purchased the Chicken flavor treats again and they were the same dark brown (nearly black) color of the Bacon flavored treats. Now only one (1) of our ferrets like the Chicken so we stopped buying both the Chicken and Bacon treats.

a-size-base: Made my ferret sick! Causes dramatic drop in blood sugar, diarrhea and vomiting in ferrets!
a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2022
a-size-base 3: My ferret started throwing up 30-45 min after eating 3 of these.  He was lethargic and it was a scary night.  After some research I found out that ferrets are not supposed to have sweet potatoes which is one of the main ingredients.  It can cause upset stomach and blood sugar issues.  Iâ€™d stay away from these treats.

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2022
a-size-base 3: I bought these and didn't realize until after I bought them that they aren't safe for ferrets. They contain sweet potato as the second ingredient. Ferrets are obligate carnivores and cannot digest vegetables, starch, etc. They also contain vegetable glycerin (essentially sugar), and sugar has been shown to cause insulinoma and/or make it worse. Consider buying freeze-dried treats (there are some marketed for cats but only contain meat and are safe).
